page.title: 09Home Life in Crowthorne
page.content: {Extracts from a ten year old's diary} "Half-past eight", Mum says. My eyes open slowly and I put my feet out of the bed. I walk down stairs with the music blaring away. My Mum says "Come and eat your breakfast,it will get cold." Everyone is wide awake except me.Dad's gone to work, Mum's reading the paper, my little brother's trying to get dressed for playschool, my older sisters are listening to their tapes before going to work and Suzie's getting ready for school.My sister says "You'll be late" and she isn't even ready herself! I beat my sister to school and the register is called."Claire, school", I say. We walk down to assembly and listen to a story. After assembly we have English. I am writing a story about a family on holiday. Then at playtime we play 'British Bulldog'.
